alert.note: Alert for Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 5:27PM MDT until June 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Cibola County in west central New Mexico... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 527 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported flash flooding over parts of the area around San Fidel. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area as more thunderstorms move over Acomita Village, Cubero, and Encinal. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cubero, San Fidel, Cebolletita, Skyline-Ganipa, New Laguna, McCartys, North Acomita Village, Encinal, Seama, Acomita, Paraje, Acomita Lake, Bibo, Seboyeta and Paguate. This includes the following highways... Mesa Hill Road, Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 87 and 107...and near Mile Marker 113, along State Roads 124 and 279, Reservation Roads 30, 9, and 47, and Lobo Canyon Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
